name: marp-vscode
description: Create slide deck written in Marp Markdown on VS Code

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Workspace trust is required for exporting slide deck, and using themes configured in the workspace.

colors.description: Forground decoration color for the key of Marp directive

commands.title: New Untitled Marp Markdown For Slide Deck
Show Quick Pick Of Marp Commands...
Toggle Marp Feature For Current Markdown

markdown.marp.breaks.description: Sets how line-breaks are rendered in Marp Markdown. It can set separately because the default setting of Marp ecosystem is different from VS Code.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Ignore line-breaks in rendered Marp Markdown preview.
Show line-breaks in rendered Marp Markdown preview. It is the default setting of Marp ecosystem.

markdown.marp.browser.description: Controls the installed browser using internally to export PDF, PPTX, and the image.
enumDescriptions: Automatically detect Chrome, Chromium, Edge, or Firefox.

markdown.marp.browserPath.markdownDescription: Configure the custom path for the installed browser using internally to export PDF, PPTX, and the image. The kind of browser is determined by `#markdown.marp.browser#`. When set to empty, Marp will find out a suitable installed browser automatically.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Disable all HTML elements, including originally allowed HTML elements by Marp.
Enable only selectively enabled HTML elements by Marp. _([See the list of HTML elements](https://github.com/marp-team/marp-core/blob/main/src/html/allowlist.ts))_
Enable all HTML elements. This setting may become the slide rendering insecure.
markdown.marp.html.description: Sets which HTML elements within Marp Markdown are enabled in rendered slides. If the workspace is not trusted, this setting treats as always "off".

markdown.marp.mathTypesetting.markdownDescription: Controls math syntax and the default library for rendering math in [Marp Core](https://github.com/marp-team/marp-core). A using library can override by math global directive in Markdown. Please note that math rendering in Marp Markdown is not following the setting in `#markdown.math.enabled#`.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Disable math syntax and math global directive.
Use MathJax (https://www.mathjax.org/). It is the default library in Marp Core v3.

markdown.marp.outlineExtension.description: Enables the outline extension for Marp Markdown. If enabled, VS Code's outline view will reflect slide splitters, and you can fold regions of the slide content in the editor.

markdown.marp.pdf.noteAnnotations.markdownDescription: Adds [presenter notes](https://marpit.marp.app/usage?id=presenter-notes) to exported PDF as note annotations.

markdown.marp.pdf.outlines.description: Adds outlines (bookmarks) to exported PDF. It is useful for navigation in PDF viewer.
enumDescriptions: Add outlines based on each slide page.
Add outlines based on each Markdown heading.
Add outlines based on both slide pages and Markdown headings.

markdown.marp.strictPathResolutionDuring.description: Enables strict path resolution during export. If enabled, the export command tries to resolve relative paths from VS Code workspace that a Markdown file belongs. If disabled, or the Markdown does not belong to any workspace, the export command resolves paths based on the local file system.

markdown.marp.themes.markdownDescription: A list of URLs or local paths to additional [theme CSS](https://marpit.marp.app/theme-css) for Marp core and Marpit framework. The rule for paths is following `#markdown.styles#`.

markdown.marp.enableHtml.description: Enables all HTML elements in Marp Markdown. This setting is working only in the trusted workspace.
markdown.marp.enableHtml.deprecationMessage: The setting "markdown.marp.enableHtml" is deprecated. Please use "markdown.marp.html" instead.

markdown.marp.chromePath.description: Sets the custom path for Chrome or Chromium-based browser to export PDF, PPTX, and image. If it's empty, Marp will find out the installed Google Chrome / Chromium / Microsoft Edge.
markdown.marp.chromePath.deprecationMessage: The setting "markdown.marp.chromePath" is deprecated. Please use "markdown.marp.browserPath" instead.
